name: 余盛延
objective: 本課程引導學生熟悉變遷中之英美文學作品典律，並探討其形成之歷史文化背景及隨變遷所產生之時代意義。課程中將討論與作品相關之社會、政治、文化、心理、哲學、理論等議題，使學生能瞭解欣賞選讀作品，並銳化其思辯能力及分析技巧。學生須於課前詳讀作品，並於課堂上參與討論。
schedule:
09/15  Introduction

09/22  General comments on Christopher Marlowe's Doctor Faustus (1604; 1616); Doctor 
       Faustus [Prologue, 1.1-1.4]

09/29  Doctor Faustus [2.1-2.3]

10/06  Doctor Faustus [3 Chorus; 3.1; 3.2]

10/13  Doctor Faustus [4 Chorus; 4.2]

10/20  Doctor Faustus [5.1-Epilogue]

10/27  Review

11/03  General Comments on Nathaniel Hawthorne's The Scarlet Letter; The Scarlet    
       Letter [The Custom-House]

11/10  The Scarlet Letter [I. The Prison-Door; II. The Market-Place; III. The Recognition]

11/17  The Scarlet Letter [IV. The Interview; V. Hester at Her Needle; VI. Pearl]

11/24  The Scarlet Letter [VII. The Governor's Hall; VIII. The Elf-Child and the 
       Minister; IX. The Leech]

12/01  The Scarlet Letter [X. The Leech and His Patient; XI. The Interior of a Heart; XII. 
       The Minister's Vigil]

12/08  The Scarlet Letter [XIII. Another view of Hester; XIV. Hester and the Physician; 
       XV. Hester and Pearl]

12/15  The Scarlet Letter [XVI. A Forest Walk; XVII. The Pastor and His Parishioner; 
       XVIII. A Flood of Sunshine]

12/22  The Scarlet Letter [XIX. The Child at the Brook-side; XX. The Minister in a Maze; 
       XXI. The New England Holiday]

12/29  The Scarlet Letter [XXII. The Procession; XXIII. The Revelation of the Scarlet 
       Letter; XXIV. Conclusion]

01/05  Final Exam

01/12  Discussion
materials:
Marlowe, Christopher. The Tragical History of Doctor Faustus. (A 1604 Version) Ed. David Bevington and Eric Rasmussen. English Renaissance Drama: A Norton Anthology. Ed. David Bevington, et al. New York: Norton, 2002. 250-284.

Hawthorne, Nathaniel. The Scarlet Letter. Ed. Brian Harding. Introd. Cindy Weinstein. Oxford: Oxford UP, 2007.
